Civilians are citizens of West Ardougne who can be found in the western section of the city, just east of the Underground Pass. When talked to, they will complain that they are busy because of the rat infestation, and say that they need a cat.

Players can sell adult, overgrown, wily and lazy cats to civilians for 100 Death runes each, or 200 after completing the Easy Ardougne Diary. This will have them take your cat away from you permanently, but you can buy a replacement from Gertrude. Note that they will not accept kittens or the Witch's cat from the Underground Pass. To sell the cat you need to use it as an item on the Civilian.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
28 May 2015
(update)

West Ardougne citizens no longer say they're giving you 100 death runes if they're actually going to give you 200.

5 March 2015
(update | poll)

Civilians now give 200 death runes for trading in a cat if you have completed the Ardougne easy diary.

5 July –
19 September 2005

The NPC was renamed from "Civillian"[sic] to "Civilian".

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • The Civilians' dialogue mentions that they get their Death runes from the dwarves who dig them out from the Underground Pass. This may be a reference to the fact that the Death Altar is located just beyond the Underground Pass.
